sn46.56:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.
sn46.56:4.3: Then Prince Abhaya went up to the Buddha,
sn46.56:4.4: bowed, sat down to one side,
sn46.56:4.7: ‘There is no cause or condition for not knowing and not seeing.
sn46.56:4.8: Not knowing and not seeing have no cause or condition.
sn46.56:4.9: There is no cause or condition for knowing and seeing.
sn46.56:4.10: Knowing and seeing have no cause or condition.’
sn46.56:4.11: What does the Buddha say about this?”
sn46.56:4.12: “Prince, there is cause and condition for not knowing and not seeing.
sn46.56:4.13: Not knowing and not seeing have causes and conditions.
sn46.56:4.14: There is cause and condition for knowing and seeing.
sn46.56:4.15: Knowing and seeing have causes and conditions.”
sn46.56:5.1: “But sir, what is the cause and condition for not knowing and not seeing?
sn46.56:5.2: How do not knowing and not seeing have causes and conditions?”
sn46.56:5.3: “There’s a time when the heart is overcome and brought low by sensual desire, without truly knowing and seeing the escape from sensual desire that has arisen.
sn46.56:5.4: This is a cause and condition for not knowing and not seeing.
sn46.56:5.5: And this is how not knowing and not seeing have causes and conditions.
sn46.56:6.1: Furthermore, there’s a time when the heart is overcome and brought low by ill will …
sn46.56:6.4: doubt, without truly knowing and seeing the escape from doubt that has arisen.
sn46.56:6.5: This is a cause and condition for not knowing and not seeing.
sn46.56:6.6: And this is how not knowing and not seeing have causes and conditions.”
sn46.56:7.1: “Sir, what is the name of this explanation of the teaching?”
sn46.56:7.4: Indeed, Holy One, these are hindrances!
sn46.56:7.5: Overcome by even a single hindrance you wouldn’t truly know or see, how much more so all five hindrances.
sn46.56:8.1: But sir, what is the cause and condition for knowing and seeing?
sn46.56:8.2: How do knowing and seeing have causes and conditions?”
sn46.56:8.3: “It’s when a mendicant develops the awakening-factor of mindfulness, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go.
sn46.56:8.4: They truly know and see with a mind that has developed the awakening factor of mindfulness.
sn46.56:8.5: This is a cause and condition for knowing and seeing.
sn46.56:8.6: And this is how knowing and seeing have causes and conditions.
sn46.56:9.1: Furthermore, a mendicant develops the awakening-factor of investigation of principles … energy … rapture … tranquility … samādhi …
sn46.56:9.2: equanimity, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go.
sn46.56:9.3: They truly know and see with a mind that has developed the awakening factor of equanimity.
sn46.56:9.4: This is a cause and condition for knowing and seeing.
sn46.56:9.5: And this is how knowing and seeing have causes and conditions.”
sn46.56:10.1: “Sir, what is the name of this explanation of the teaching?”
sn46.56:10.3: “Indeed, Blessed One, these are awakening factors!
sn46.56:10.4: Indeed, Holy One, these are awakening factors!
sn46.56:10.5: Endowed with even a single awakening factor you would truly know and see, how much more so all seven awakening factors.
sn46.56:10.6: When climbing Mount Vulture’s Peak I became fatigued in body and mind. But this has now faded away. And I’ve comprehended the teaching.”
